user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirClose_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_DirClose_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token);

    closedir(impl->dp);
    impl->dp = NULL;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_DirClose_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
...
typedef struct
{
    DIR *dp;
} OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragments in the provided function appear to be statically unreachable. The function has a single, straight-line control flow: retrieve table entry (impl), call closedir(impl->dp), set impl->dp = NULL, then return OS_SUCCESS. There are no conditionals, loops, gotos, early returns, or code following a return that would create unreachable code. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET expands to an array access using OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(*token)) which simplifies to OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(token); OS_ObjectIndexFromToken is an inline accessor that returns token->obj_idx, so the macro usage here does not introduce unreachable code. Although runtime issues (for example, if token is NULL or impl->dp is NULL) could cause undefined behavior at execution, such runtime faults do not constitute statically unreachable code per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 and therefore do not need investigation for this rule. The macro’s use of &(tok) could be problematic if a non-lvalue were passed, but in this call the argument is *token (an lvalue), so that case does not apply here.
